conclusion: To determine when particles A and B meet, find the time when their positions are equal by comparing areas under the velocity-time graphs.
Velocity-time graph shows particle A's velocity increases to 2v0 at t0, then decreases to 0 at 3t0. Particle B's velocity increases to v0 at 5t0, then decreases to 0 at 6t0.
Identify the equations for the velocities of A and B.
Calculate the position of A as a function of time from 0 to t0.
Calculate the position of A as a function of time from t0 to 3t0.
Calculate the position of B as a function of time from 0 to 5t0.
Calculate the position of B as a function of time from 5t0 to 6t0.
Set the positions equal to find the meeting time.
